issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram VI on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with two mural elements, crescent above forehead; crescent, above covered korymbos; ribbon commencing to the left below crescent, pointing to the left; double pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing to the left and right behind the shoulders; pointing upwards; earing consisting of three elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; crescent on left and right shoulder; both shoulders decorated with crescent and star; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast, star in left and right upper field; crescent at 3 h, 6 h and 9 h; rigged border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 2 h l. i.’whlmzd, 11 h l. o. ʼpzwn'| Wahām abzōn| “Wahram, increase”
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements, altar shaft, to the left and the right of the shaft ribbons pointing upwards; four altar slabs; altar flames rendered as four tiers of four, three, two and one strokes respectively; star to left of altar flames, crescent to the right; to the left and the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Wistham fronting, holding sword with both hands, right hand above left hand, both frontal; regnal year at 9 h; ridged border
